00063 #include <stdlib.h>             /* ANSI memory controls */
00064 #include <DAVE3.h>
00065 
00066 
00067 #if _FS_REENTRANT
00068 
00069 extern FATFS003_MutexInfoType FATFS003_MutexInfo[FATFS003_MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES];
00070 
00071 
00072 extern volatile osMutexId FATFS003_MutexProtectId;
00073 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00074 /* Create a Synchronization Object                                        */
00075 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00076 /* This function is called in f_mount function to create a new
00077 /  synchronization object, such as semaphore and mutex. When a zero is
00078 /  returned, the f_mount function fails with FR_INT_ERR.
00079 */
00080 
00081 int ff_cre_syncobj (    /* TRUE:Function succeeded, FALSE:Could not create due to any error */
00082         BYTE vol,                       /* Corresponding logical drive being processed */
00083         _SYNC_t *sobj           /* Pointer to return the created sync object */
00084 )
00085 {
00086   uint32_t MutexCount = 0;
00087   int RetVal = -1;
00088   osStatus SemStatus;
00089 /* Check for available Mutexes. */
00090 /* Take Mutex */
00091   SemStatus = osMutexWait(FATFS003_MutexProtectId,  osWaitForever );
00092   if (osOK == SemStatus)
00093   {
00094     for (MutexCount=0; MutexCount<FATFS003_MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES; MutexCount++)
00095     {
00096       if( FATFS003_MutexInfo[MutexCount].MutexStatus == FATFS003_FREE)
00097       {
00098           *sobj = FATFS003_MutexInfo[MutexCount].MutexId;
00099           /* Remove the allocated mutex from free list*/
00100           FATFS003_MutexInfo[MutexCount].MutexStatus =  FATFS003_BUSY;
00101           RetVal =  (int)*sobj;
00102           break;
00103       }
00104     }/* End of "for loop"*/
00105     SemStatus = osMutexRelease (FATFS003_MutexProtectId);
00106     if (SemStatus != osOK)
00107     {
00108       ERROR(GID_FATFS003,FATFS003_MUTEX_RELEASE_FAILED,0,0);
00109       RetVal = -1;
00110     } /* End of "if (osOK != SemStatus)"*/
00111   } /* End of " if ((uint32_t)osOK != SemStatus)"*/
00112   return RetVal;
00113 }
00114 
00115 
00116 
00117 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00118 /* Delete a Synchronization Object                                        */
00119 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00120 /* This function is called in f_mount function to delete a synchronization
00121 /  object that created with ff_cre_syncobj function. When a zero is
00122 /  returned, the f_mount function fails with FR_INT_ERR.
00123 */
00124 
00125 int ff_del_syncobj (    /* TRUE:Function succeeded, FALSE:Could not delete due to any error */
00126         _SYNC_t sobj            /* Sync object tied to the logical drive to be deleted */
00127 )
00128 {
00129   uint32_t RetVal;
00130   uint32_t MutexCount = 0;
00131   for (MutexCount=0;MutexCount<FATFS003_MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES; MutexCount++)
00132   {
00133         if(FATFS003_MutexInfo[MutexCount].MutexId == sobj)
00134         {
00135            /* Remove the allocated mutex from free list*/
00136                 FATFS003_MutexInfo[MutexCount].MutexStatus = FATFS003_FREE;
00137         }
00138   }
00139 /*Return Status will be always 1 */
00140   RetVal = 1;
00141   return RetVal;
00142 }
00143 
00144 
00145 
00146 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00147 /* Request Grant to Access the Volume                                     */
00148 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00149 /* This function is called on entering file functions to lock the volume.
00150 /  When a zero is returned, the file function fails with FR_TIMEOUT.
00151 */
00152 
00153 int ff_req_grant (      /* TRUE:Got a grant to access the volume, FALSE:Could not get a grant */
00154         _SYNC_t sobj    /* Sync object to wait */
00155 )
00156 {
00157   osStatus Status;
00158   int RetVal = 1;
00159 /* Wait till the Mutex becomes available  */
00160   Status = (int )osMutexWait(sobj, _FS_TIMEOUT );
00161   if (Status != osOK )
00162   {
00163     RetVal = 0;
00164   }
00165   return RetVal;
00166 }
00167 
00168 
00169 
00170 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00171 /* Release Grant to Access the Volume                                     */
00172 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00173 /* This function is called on leaving file functions to unlock the volume.
00174 */
00175 
00176 void ff_rel_grant (
00177         _SYNC_t sobj    /* Sync object to be signaled */
00178 )
00179 {
00180   osMutexRelease (sobj);
00181 }
00182 
00183 #endif
